text: Joanne Fath (born 1945 (or December 1944)) is a Canadian former long track speed skater from Edmonton, who was active in the 1960s.Skater Joanne Fath Leaving For Europe Edmonton Journal (Edmonton, Alberta, Canada), p. 22, 19 December 1962 ==Biography== Fath is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. R. T. Fath, living in Edmonton. She went to St. Mary's High School. Fath started with skating when she was four years old at the McKernan Community rink in McKernan, Edmonton. In the early 1960s she qualified for the national speed skating team in the 500m, 1000m, 1500m and 3000m trials held at the Edmonton oval. In December 1962, aged 17, she went as part of the national team, composing of eight Canadian speed skaters, to Europe for a six-week training project in Sweden. At the 1964 Canadian Allround Championships she won the silver medal behind Doreen McCannell. Fath represented her nation at the World Allround Speed Skating Championships for Women in 1965, finishing 26th overall. She also competed in 1965 in Finland and Norway. == Records== === Personal records === ==References== Category:Sportspeople from Edmonton Category:Canadian female speed skaters Category:Living people Category:1945 births Category:Date of birth missing (living people)
title: Joanne Fath
